abstract.text: A format style that provides string representations of byte counts, expressed as measurements of information storage.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to format byte counts according to locale conventions.
The following example creates a measurement of 1,024 bytes, and then formats it as an expression of memory storage, with the default byte count format style:
You can also customize a byte count format style, and use this to format one or more
instances. The following example creates a format style to only use kilobyte units, and to spell out the exact byte count of the measurement.

abstract.text: A format style that converts byte counts into attributed strings.
A type that provides localized representations of measurements.
A format style that provides string representations of byte counts, expressed as measurements of information storage.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two values are equal.
The units the format style can use to express the byte count.
An attributed format style based on the byte count format style.
Returns a format style for formatting a measurement of data storage.
Returns a format style to use floating-point currency notation.
Returns a format style to use integer currency notation.
Encodes the value into the given encoder.
Formats a byte count measurment, using this style.
Hashes the essential components of the value by feeding them into the given hasher.
The hash value.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the format style should include the exact byte count, in addition to expressing it in terms of units.
Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.
Initializes a byte count format style.
Returns a format style to format a list of items.
Returns a format style to format a list of strings.
The locale to use to format the numeric part of the byte count.
Modifies the format style to use the specified locale.
Returns a format style to format temperature units.
Returns a format style to format measurement units.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the format style should spell out zero-byte values as text.
The style of byte count to express, such as memory or file system storage.
The type of data to format.
The type of the formatted data.
The type used to represent the style of the formatted byte count.
The type the measurement format style uses to represent byte-counting units.
